sentences.sContent: Police have found what appear to be human remains.
sentences.sCn: 警方发现了疑似人体遗骸的东西。

sentences.sContent: He tried to make it appear that she had committed suicide.
sentences.sCn: 他试图制造她自杀的假象。

sentences.sContent: It may be less useful than it appears at first.
sentences.sCn: 这可能没有一开始显得那么有用。

sentences.sContent: Two faces appeared at our window.
sentences.sCn: 两张面孔出现在我们的窗口。

sentences.sContent: The car seemed to appear from nowhere.
sentences.sCn: 这辆车好像是突然间从哪里冒出来的。

sentences.sContent: ...More on this study and the star ratings will appear in a subsequent post...
...And they all appear to be uninjured...
...it's natural to look for what may appear to be the most“practical” way out of the problem:“Major in a subject designed to get you a job” seems the obvious answer to some...
...but do it fast enough and "the results appear to be magic"...
...The study will appear in the November issue of The Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology...

trans.tranOther: used to say how something seems, especially from what you know about it or from what you can see
